paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the KCNH2 gene variant c.2738C>T (p.Ala913Val) found in a familial case of cutis laxa.

individual_records.phenotype_details: dry, thin and wrinkled skin that appeared prematurely aged
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Both patients have dry, wrinkled skin and look older than their age.

individual_records.phenotype_details: dry, wrinkled skin and skin laxity first noticed at the age of 1 year
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Skin laxity was first noticed at the age of 1 year.

functional_data.summary: The mutation is considered pathogenic according to ACMG recommendations.

variants.segregation_data: The variant was found in both the proband and her son, indicating segregation with the disease.
variants.population_frequency: Not reported in literature or databases.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on ACMG classification.
variants.additional_notes: The variant was described in the context of a digenic form of congenital long-QT syndrome.
key_quotes: We also found that the proband and his son have two missense mutations: the c.2738C>T (p.Ala913Val) in the KCNH2 gene.

extraction_metadata.notes: Only one variant in KCNH2 was reported in the paper.
